title: Message caught in Break tab but break buttons remain disabled

milestone.description: Enhancements and bug fixes expected to be included in a following main release.

body:
Steps to reproduce the issue:
1. Run ZAP with WebSockets add-on;
2. Enable Options > WebSockets > Break on enabled 'all request/response break buttons';
3. Establish a WebSocket connection, e.g. `http://www.websocket.org/echo.html`
4. Start breaking on all requests and responses;
5. Send two WebSocket messages from the client (that end up being echoed by the server);
6. Start stepping (slowly to give time to the server to send the echoes);
7. Note that in the end an echoed message is shown in the Break tab, but the break buttons are disabled, preventing the message from being dispatched or dropped.

Remarks:
 - While the issue is reproducible with WebSocket messages the cause is in a core class, `BreakpointMessageHandler2` (more precisely, around the `synchronized` blocks).
 - It's possible to interact with the caught message using break API.

Thread dump showing the relevant threads blocked:
```
"ZAP-ProxyThread-164" - Thread t@594
   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.brk.BreakpointMessageHandler2.handleMessageReceivedFromServer(BreakpointMessageHandler2.java:103)
	- waiting to lock <475c7579> (a java.lang.Object) owned by "ZAP-WS-Listener (remote) 'localhost:3000 (#3)'" t@231
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.brk.ExtensionBreak.messageReceivedFromServer(ExtensionBreak.java:600)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.brk.impl.http.ProxyListenerBreak.onHttpResponseReceive(ProxyListenerBreak.java:86)
	at org.parosproxy.paros.core.proxy.ProxyThread.notifyListenerResponseReceive(ProxyThread.java:701)
	at org.parosproxy.paros.core.proxy.ProxyThread.processHttp(ProxyThread.java:522)
	- locked <74073673> (a java.lang.Object)
	at org.parosproxy.paros.core.proxy.ProxyThread.run(ProxyThread.java:318)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

   Locked ownable synchronizers:
	- None

"ZAP-WS-Listener (remote) 'localhost:3000 (#3)'" - Thread t@231
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING
	at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.brk.BreakpointMessageHandler2.waitUntilContinue(BreakpointMessageHandler2.java:124)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.brk.BreakpointMessageHandler2.handleMessageReceivedFromServer(BreakpointMessageHandler2.java:106)
	- locked <475c7579> (a java.lang.Object)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.brk.WebSocketProxyListenerBreak.onMessageFrame(WebSocketProxyListenerBreak.java:105)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.WebSocketProxy.notifyMessageObservers(WebSocketProxy.java:685)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.WebSocketProxy.processRead(WebSocketProxy.java:578)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.WebSocketListener.run(WebSocketListener.java:89)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

   Locked ownable synchronizers:
	- locked <55025bf6> (a java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker)

"ZAP-WS-Listener (remote) 'localhost:3000 (#4)'" - Thread t@329
   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.brk.BreakpointMessageHandler2.handleMessageReceivedFromServer(BreakpointMessageHandler2.java:103)
	- waiting to lock <475c7579> (a java.lang.Object) owned by "ZAP-WS-Listener (remote) 'localhost:3000 (#3)'" t@231
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.brk.WebSocketProxyListenerBreak.onMessageFrame(WebSocketProxyListenerBreak.java:105)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.WebSocketProxy.notifyMessageObservers(WebSocketProxy.java:685)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.WebSocketProxy.processRead(WebSocketProxy.java:578)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.WebSocketListener.run(WebSocketListener.java:89)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

   Locked ownable synchronizers:
	- locked <731c0155> (a java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker)
```

ZAP
Version 2.7.0 (and older).
